Key Match Events: Peyton Watson blocked a shot in the closing seconds after missing a pair of free throws at the other end.
Nikola Jokic finished with 23 points, 20 rebounds and 16 assists.
Michael Porter Jr. scored 21 of his 24 points in the second half.
Peyton Watson swatted the shot of a driving Shai Gilgeous-Alexander just before the buzzer sounded.
Jalen Williams led the Thunder with 29 points, 10 rebounds and nine assists.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The short-handed Nuggets were without power forward Aaron Gordon (strained calf) and point guard Jamal Murray (concussion protocol).
The Thunder allowed 69 points in the second half despite entering the contest giving up a league-low 95.9 points a game.
Denver struggled to keep its cool at times, with both coach Michael Malone and Russell Westbrook receiving technical fouls.
The Nuggets went on a 17-7 run to take control of the game when down 108-106.
For the seventh time in eight games, the Nuggets were outscored in the first quarter (32-30).
